questions.question: The car broke ………………………. at the most inopportune time.
questions.description: When things break down, they stop working.

questions.question: I will call you ………………………. in the afternoon.
questions.description: To call someone back is to return a call.

questions.question: Talk to him after he has calmed ……………………… a bit.
questions.description: To calm down is to become less upset or angry.

questions.question: I desperately need someone to cheer me …………………………
questions.description: To cheer someone up is to make them happy.

questions.question: She did ………………………. the buttons on her jacket.
questions.description: To do something up is to fasten it.

questions.question: I tripped on a bag and fell ……………………..
questions.description: To fall over is to fall to the ground.

questions.question: Fill ………………………… the form before sending it.
questions.description: To fill out a form is to write information in the spaces on a form.

questions.question: It took me a long time to get ………………………. the loss.
questions.description: To get over something is to start feeling better again.

questions.question: We will not give ………………………. to their demands.
questions.description: To give in is to agree to do something although you are not interested in it.

questions.question: Although she failed many times, she never thought of giving ……………………….
questions.description: To give up is to stop doing something

questions.question: She kept …………………… talking about her problems.
questions.description: To keep on doing something is to continue doing it.

questions.question: Why did you leave him ……………………….?
questions.description: To leave somebody out is to not include someone.
